connections.description: Maraqasi (earlier Gurgum) was the capital of the Neo-Hittite state Gurgum.

history.comment: Edited; changed connection to 'capital of', rather than 'part of (administration)'.

names.description: Ethnic name used to designate a person from Gurgum (city) in royal inscriptions of the Assyrian kings Shalmaneser III (r. 858-824 BC) and Adad-nerari III (r. 809-782 BC).
names.details: Gurgum is also the name of a Neo-Hittite state. Marqasi is the name of the city in later Assyrian sources.

names.description: Name of Maraş in royal inscriptions of the ninth-century-BC Assyrian king Shalmaneser III (r. 858-824 BC).
names.details: Gurgum is also the name of a Neo-Hittite state. Maraqasi is the name of the city in later Assyrian sources.
